snippet: Iran’s top nuclear negotiator would not elaborate on the substance of the “new initiatives, ” but the move appeared to be an attempt at conciliation ahead of the talks on Friday.
abstract: Saeed Jalili, Iran’s top nuclear negotiator says that he will offer 'new initiatives' at the coming talks with world powers on its disputed nuclear program, apparently trying to strike a posture of conciliation without specifying which ideas he intends to propose; remarks represent the first time he publicly suggested that Iran would present something new at the talks since an agreement on resuming them was announced last month.
lead_paragraph: Iran’s top nuclear negotiator would not elaborate on the substance of the “new initiatives, ” but the move appeared to be an attempt at conciliation ahead of the talks on Friday.

headline.seo: Iran Says It Will Offer New Nuclear Proposals
headline.main: Iran Says It Will Offer Unspecified Proposals at Coming Nuclear Negotiations
headline.print_headline: Iran Says It Will Offer Unspecified Proposals at Coming Nuclear Negotiations
